page.title: 15Inverkeithing & Farming
page.content:
In this area the main crops are wheat, barley, oats, potatoes and turnips. Grazing is not very popular although it does take place.
Ever since the{E.E.C.}started paying farmers to grow{oilseed rape,}to get the oil, to make margerines, this has become a very popular crop. It is easily recognised when it is in full bloom as the flowers are plentiful and also are bright yellow.
The farmer who farms nearest the shool plants his crops in rotation. The field directly opposite the school usually has wheat, barley or oats in it but this year it was planted with rapeseed, as were quite a few other fields.
